title: Pixel 2 XL will only play music through speakers when accessories are plugged into usb-c port.
content:
Started my day listen to music via Spotify through my phone into a USB-C adapter, aux cord, and into my car. That lasted about a minute before abrubtly stopping and playing through my phone's speaker. I rebooted my phone, and it started working again for about 25 minutes before it cut out again. I have not been able to play music through an aux cord since that happened this morning. I have purchased a new aux cord and adapter/dongle, and tried every combination through my car with no luck. I also tried with my earbuds that plug directly into the usb-c with no luck. I have plugged in a charger to my phone and it does charge, so I don't think it is an issue with my phone's port. 

The earbuds and the original dongle are certified Google products. The two aux cords and the newer usb-c are not, as none were available at the store. I am pretty sure I have narrowed it down to a problem on my phones software, but I do not know where to go from here. I have rebooted my phone over 5 times since the first issue both through the selection after holding the power button as well as holding the power and volume button together for 10 seconds. 

I am traveling 10+ hours the next 3 days, so the sooner I get a solution, the sooner I can get back to listening to music while driving.
